slap something ↔ on.translation[0].defin: to put or spread something quickly or carelessly onto a surface
She ran upstairs and slapped on some make-up.
We could slap some paint on it.
to suddenly announce a new charge, tax etc or say that something is not allowed – used especially when you think this is unfair
Many tour operators slap on supplements for single people.
In 1977, the president slapped a ban on the commercial reprocessing of nuclear fuel.
